sub_title: Founder / Lead Consultant at Reijer Consulting
summary: Social scientist with a PhD in child well-being and 15+ years’ experience specializing in data analysis, monitoring, research, evaluation, capacity building, HIV/AIDS, international development,  and skills/experience transfer. Diplomatic, flexible and self-driven with strong ability to come to the core of complex issues as well as large data sets to identify what matters. Adept team builder and team leader, with experience of having led a global M&E team of 350+ colleagues working in over 30 countries.

profile_positions.description: Expert services in qualitative and quantitative data collection, data ecosystems, data visualisation,  data analytics, data storytelling, training and capacity building, planning, monitoring, evaluation and policy formulation and analysis. current portfolio includes UNICEF HQ, UNICEF ROSA, UN-HABITAT, and AIDS Healthcare Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Founder / Lead Consultant

profile_positions.location: Regional Office for South Asia - Kathmandu Nepal
profile_positions.title: Statistics and Monitoring Specialist
Global Director of Data & Analytics
Global Programs Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Conducting of a PhD research on the topic of Orphans and Vulnerable Children (OVCs) who are growing up in households, without a middle generation, that are headed by elderly caregivers in Southern Africa. This research was funded by the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs. 

Core Duties: 

•	Pursuing a PhD by means of a dissertation 
•	Fourteen months of fieldwork in rural Zambia, consisting of qualitative and quantitative data collection
•	Teaching experience in anthropology, child development, ecological approaches, child mortality & maternal health, formal & social protection programmes
•	Supervision of bachelor and master’s students
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
Four annual secondments to the Ministry from the University of Amsterdam as part of the IS Academy on HIV/AIDS framework. I was seconded to the department for Social Development (DSO) within the Health and AIDS unit (GA). The secondments took place during 8 to 10 weeks and included different tasks, including:

•	Research and author an overview of all social protection projects carried out by Embassies or funded by the Ministry
•	Co-authoring three chapters on MDG 4,5 and 6 in the 2008 monitoring report on progress made by the Netherlands between in 2007-2008 towards realizing the Millennium Development Goals 
•	Working together with the Special Envoy Food and Nutrition Security for Development Mr. Paulus Verschuren on food security issues in Zambia and preparing a background document on food security and social protection among vulnerable groups in rural Zambia
•	Participating in the Working group on Social Protection, Rural development and Social Security
profile_positions.title: Seconded Researcher IS Academy

profile_positions.description:
Data-manager of the UNFPA/UNAIDS/NIDI Financial Resource Flows for Population and AIDS Project and Researcher with the Population and Development Department of NIDI. 

Core Duties: 

•	Contributing to in-depth studies related to health financing, health policy, sexual and reproductive health, maternal health and out-of-pocket expenditures
•	Data and database manager
•	Focal point for UNAIDS, OECD/DAC and external data requests
•	Key-duties in the annual Resource Flows survey of donor and domestic respondents worldwide
•	Responsible for outsourcing operation of the project, training and evaluation of outsourcing partner
•	Estimation and projecting of future financial resource flows
profile_positions.title: Researcher and Data Manager - Resource Flows Project

profile_positions.description:
Database Consultant for a research programme on the effectiveness of Highly Active Anti-Retroviral Treatment (HAART) in Zambia and Namibia

Core Duties:

•	Design and implement the monitoring and analysis database for the project in Ms. Access
•	Providing of training for project staff on the database and on Access/MySQL
•	Monitoring and assisting data entry at the two survey location in Monze (Zambia) and Rehoboth (Namibia)
•	Assisting in data analysis including preparing queries for data monitoring and analysis
profile_positions.title: Database and Research consultant

profile_positions.description: Salesperson on the Outdoors Department of the largest sports-shop in Utrecht and purchaser responsible for all skiing, mountain-biking, camping, and skating supplies for an Intersport franchise consisting of eight shops.
profile_positions.title: Salesperson and Purchaser

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the collection and implementation of field data for one of the largest navigable map systems in the Netherlands including provincial responsibility for two Dutch provinces.
profile_positions.title: Geographical Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: Providing guest-lectures for the Dutch Association of Paediatricians, the Primary and Community Care department of the Radboud University Nijmegen, the Dutch Ministry for Foreign Affairs, the Dutch Working Group on Children Affected by AIDS, The Dutch Working Group on Rural Development, Food Security and Social Protection, and providing introductions to HIV/AIDS and the health-related MDGs for several Dutch Student’s associations
